title.narrative: EMERGENCY COORDINATION

description.narrative: By 2021, all countries implement a robust preparedness strategy, and countries with major emergencies have put in place adequate response planning and field monitoring, with robust information management systems, to implement the CCCs, including Early Recovery Commitments., which contributes to Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: RO and COs implement adequate cross sectoral strategies to improve programming excellence and achieve quality and equitable results for children.

NUTRITION DIVISION MINISTRY OF HEAL AND SANITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, all countries implement a robust preparedness strategy, and countries with major emergencies have put in place adequateresponse planning and field monitoring, with robust information management systems, to implement the CCCs, including Early RecoveryCommitments.

description.narrative: In 2021 UNICEF West and Central Africa Regional Office ensured strategy and technical support to 24 countries in their preparedness, monitoring and response to major humanitarian situations, including the COVID-19pandemic and its socio-economic impact, epidemics (Ebola, Cholera, Polio), protracted conflicts with spill-over in high-risk countries, population displacement and natural disasters. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/02/2022
